importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article update, indicating the most current information about the MLB postseason as of Friday, October 17, 2025.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current state of the postseason, specifically the NLCS and ALCS, is being reported as of this date, with critical game outcomes and standings being assessed in real time.

keyTakeAways: The Los Angeles Dodgers are one game away from a second consecutive World Series appearance after a 3-1 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers in the NLCS.
The Dodgers now lead the NLCS 3-0, making them the first defending champion in 16 years to reach the World Series, a feat last achieved by the 2009 Philadelphia Phillies.

The Milwaukee Brewers' pitcher Jacob Misiorowski struck out nine, setting a rookie postseason record, and the Dodgers scored in the sixth inning on Tommy Edman’s RBI single and a throwing error by Abner Uribe.
The Boston Red Sox are the only team in MLB history to win a best-of-seven series after losing the first three games, with 40 other teams winning when they held a 3-0 lead.
The Toronto Blue Jays have tied the Seattle Mariners in the ALCS after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, making the series competitive again.
Max Scherzer, 41 years old, pitched 5 2/3 innings allowing only two runs and three hits, and Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his fifth playoff home run.
The Blue Jays are now in a position to take the series lead in the ALCS, with momentum from their recent victories.
The Dodgers have a 8-1 postseason record, with their only loss being to the Philadelphia Phillies in the NLDS.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees are referenced as the last team to win back-to-back World Series titles between 1998 and 2000, providing historical context for the rarity of a second straight appearance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Los Angeles Dodgers are one game away from securing a second consecutive World Series appearance after defeating the Milwaukee Brewers 3-1 in the National League Championship Series, now leading 3-0. This milestone makes them the first defending champion in 16 years to reach the World Series, following the 2009 Philadelphia Phillies. The game was tightly contested, with Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski striking out nine—setting a rookie postseason record—and a key scoring play by Dodgers’ Tommy Edman and a throwing error by Abner Uribe. Meanwhile, the Toronto Blue Jays have tied the Seattle Mariners in the American League Championship Series after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, with Max Scherzer and Vladimir Guerrero Jr. playing key roles. The Dodgers have an 8-1 postseason record, their only loss to the Phillies in the NLDS, and the Blue Jays now hold momentum to take the ALCS series lead.
title: Dodgers close in on second straight World Series appearance, Blue Jays knot up ALCS against Mariners
